alert.note: Alert for Northern Gila County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 8:41PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT GILA COUNTY THROUGH 915 PM MST... At 840 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gisela, or 11 miles south of Payson, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Buck Mountain, Buck Peak, Robbers Roost Mtn, Oak Spring Canyon, Lookout Point, McFadden Peak, Jakes Corner, Gisela, Rye, Pine Mountain, McDonald Mountain, and Deer Creek. This includes the following highways... State Route 188 between mile markers 267 and 276. State Route 87 southbound between mile markers 241 and 242. State Route 87 between mile markers 233 and 245. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
